{"__typename":"RiskHazardsWithMethod","hazards":[{"__typename":"RiskHazard","identifiedHazard":"Stage Plan Section: 1. Planning 
Hazard: Personnel fatigue 
Consequence: Personal injury, Oversight leading to pollution, Loss of concentrations","existingMeasures":"1. Ensure personnel involved are well rested. 
2. Ensure sufficient personal available and those involved are regularly hydrated. Regular breaks to be taken. 
3. To have OIC, Signal Man, Crane operator as minimum and one person on the guide rope. ","additionalMeasures":null,"likelihood":3,"consequence":3,"likelihoodAfterExistingMeasures":3,"consequenceAfterExistingMeasures":3,"likelihoodAfterAdditionalMeasures":null,"consequenceAfterAdditionalMeasures":null},{"__typename":"RiskHazard","identifiedHazard":"Stage Plan Section: 1. Planning 
Hazard: Training/Inexperience in crane handling. 
Consequence: Personal Injury","existingMeasures":"1. Conduct familiarization training and issue certificate to individuals authorised to operating lifting plant 
a. Prior operating lifting equipment as per Form 473 
b. Certificate is valid for duration of individual's tour of duty extended to one year for individual returning to the same vessel 
2. Proper Supervision by senior crew or officer. 
3. Carry out a thorough Reverse Tool Box Talk, addressing all process safety and personal safety hazards and barriers.","additionalMeasures":null,"likelihood":2,"consequence":3,"likelihoodAfterExistingMeasures":2,"consequenceAfterExistingMeasures":3,"likelihoodAfterAdditionalMeasures":null,"consequenceAfterAdditionalMeasures":null},{"__typename":"RiskHazard","identifiedHazard":"Stage Plan Section: 1. Planning 
Hazard: Weather conditions 
Consequence: Personal injury, accidental disconnection of hoses.","existingMeasures":"1. Close monitoring of weather. 
2. OOW to monitor weather closely and advise expected adverse weather changes. 
3. Lifting operations should not be executed if vessel is rolling","additionalMeasures":null,"likelihood":2,"consequence":5,"likelihoodAfterExistingMeasures":2,"consequenceAfterExistingMeasures":5,"likelihoodAfterAdditionalMeasures":null,"consequenceAfterAdditionalMeasures":null},{"__typename":"RiskHazard","identifiedHazard":"Stage Plan Section: 1. Preparation 
Hazard: Slips and falls 
Consequence: Personnel injured","existingMeasures":"1. Ensure deck is free of oil, any obstractions in way should be highlighted. 
2. Keep hoist area clean & tidy. 
3. Clear a load before receiving further items.","additionalMeasures":null,"likelihood":3,"consequence":2,"likelihoodAfterExistingMeasures":3,"consequenceAfterExistingMeasures":2,"likelihoodAfterAdditionalMeasures":null,"consequenceAfterAdditionalMeasures":null},{"__typename":"RiskHazard","identifiedHazard":"Stage Plan Section: 1. Planning 
Hazard: Condition of Lifting Appliances 
Consequence: Personnel Injury, Equipment Damage","existingMeasures":"1. Wire ropes should be regularly inspected and treated with suitable lubricants. 
2. Check records before use of equipment. 
3. Keep Register of ship's lifting appliances (ROLA) updated. 
4. The lifting straps must be inspected for condition prior every operation.  
5. Remove from service damaged lifting gear SWL of lifting equipment must be clearly identified. 
6. The weight of the object (s) to be lifted determined or estimated. 
7. Every part of a load that is used in lifting it, as well as anything attached to the load and used for that purpose, should be of good construction, of adequate strength for the purpose for which it is to be used and free from defects. 
8. Cordon off the working area.","additionalMeasures":null,"likelihood":2,"consequence":3,"likelihoodAfterExistingMeasures":2,"consequenceAfterExistingMeasures":3,"likelihoodAfterAdditionalMeasures":null,"consequenceAfterAdditionalMeasures":null},{"__typename":"RiskHazard","identifiedHazard":"Stage Plan Section: 1. Planning 
Hazard: Working Enviroment 
Consequence: Personnel Injury","existingMeasures":"1. Operation should be done in comfortable enviroment, e.g.: extreme temperatures, poor ventilation, poor lighting etc. should be avoided","additionalMeasures":null,"likelihood":3,"consequence":1,"likelihoodAfterExistingMeasures":3,"consequenceAfterExistingMeasures":1,"likelihoodAfterAdditionalMeasures":null,"consequenceAfterAdditionalMeasures":null},{"__typename":"RiskHazard","identifiedHazard":"Stage Plan Section: 1. Preparation 
Hazard: Lack of supervision 
Consequence: Personal injury, Damage to equipment","existingMeasures":"1. Additional engineer to maintain overall view & constant supervision of job in progress. 
2. Intervene when/where required. 
3. Ensure only personnel agree before as per job scope is involved in task. 
4. Ensure working area is baricade in place","additionalMeasures":null,"likelihood":3,"consequence":2,"likelihoodAfterExistingMeasures":3,"consequenceAfterExistingMeasures":2,"likelihoodAfterAdditionalMeasures":null,"consequenceAfterAdditionalMeasures":null},{"__typename":"RiskHazard","identifiedHazard":"Stage Plan Section: 2. Preparation 
Hazard: Night time Operation, Poor illumination 
Consequence: Slips, trips & fall leading to personal injury, slow reaction","existingMeasures":"1. Deck flood lights on. 
2. Approved torches used. ","additionalMeasures":null,"likelihood":2,"consequence":3,"likelihoodAfterExistingMeasures":2,"consequenceAfterExistingMeasures":3,"likelihoodAfterAdditionalMeasures":null,"consequenceAfterAdditionalMeasures":null},{"__typename":"RiskHazard","identifiedHazard":"Stage Plan Section: 2. Worksite Preparation 
Hazard: Manual lifting Ergonomics 
Consequence: Personnel Injury","existingMeasures":"1. Correct lifting techniques i.e. straight back, bend at the knees.	
2. Be aware of your surroundings. 
3. Take Sensible precautation to ensure that you are aware of any risk of injury from load before picking up. 
4. Some loads require two or more people to lift safely. 
5. Find the heaviest part of the object and keep this closest to your body to prevent stress and help your balance.	 
6. Ideally the feet should be about shoulder width apart, with one foot facing forward towards the intended item in the direction of travel.	 
7. Avoid lifting and turning movements as these could cause loss of body balanc and could in turn cause injury to the spinal column.	 
8. Squat down keeping your back straight and bending the knees, tucking in the chin when lifting or putting objects down as this helps to keep the spine straight. 
9. Never bend your back whilst lifting as this puts too much strain on the spine.	
10.  When lifting always bend the knees and push up with the legs and use a palm grip while keeping the load as close to the body as possible use only these technique while lifting any objects or materials at work.","additionalMeasures":null,"likelihood":3,"consequence":2,"likelihoodAfterExistingMeasures":3,"consequenceAfterExistingMeasures":2,"likelihoodAfterAdditionalMeasures":null,"consequenceAfterAdditionalMeasures":null},{"__typename":"RiskHazard","identifiedHazard":"Stage Plan Section: 2. Worksite Preparation 
Hazard: Sharp Edges / Damaged  Packaging 
Consequence: Personnel Injury","existingMeasures":"Check object before handling. 
Wear impact & cut resistant gloves for protection. 
Ensure product container/package is in good condition before handling.	","additionalMeasures":null,"likelihood":3,"consequence":2,"likelihoodAfterExistingMeasures":3,"consequenceAfterExistingMeasures":2,"likelihoodAfterAdditionalMeasures":null,"consequenceAfterAdditionalMeasures":null},{"__typename":"RiskHazard","identifiedHazard":"Stage Plan Section: 3. Lifting and Connecting Hose 
Hazard: Swinging of Hook 
Consequence: Personal Injury, Damage to boat. Fatality.","existingMeasures":"1. Attach strong line to hook. 
2. Keep the line under tension at all tims. 
3. Prevent swinging of hook. 
4. Use proper extention hook","additionalMeasures":null,"likelihood":2,"consequence":4,"likelihoodAfterExistingMeasures":2,"consequenceAfterExistingMeasures":4,"likelihoodAfterAdditionalMeasures":null,"consequenceAfterAdditionalMeasures":null},{"__typename":"RiskHazard","identifiedHazard":"Stage Plan Section: 3. Execution 
Hazard: Falling Objects / Failure of Lifting Appliances 
Consequence: Personnel Injury","existingMeasures":"1. Under no circumstances should personnel stand on, stand below or pass beneath a load that is being lifted. 
2. Load to be well secured before lifting. Do not overload strops / cargo net. 
3. A load greater than the SWL of lifting equipment must not be lifted. 
4. Lifting strops should not be passed around edges liable to cause damage. 
5. Reduce load if too much is being lifted or load is not secure. 
6. Ensure product container/package is in good condition before handling.","additionalMeasures":null,"likelihood":2,"consequence":3,"likelihoodAfterExistingMeasures":2,"consequenceAfterExistingMeasures":3,"likelihoodAfterAdditionalMeasures":null,"consequenceAfterAdditionalMeasures":null},{"__typename":"RiskHazard","identifiedHazard":"Stage Plan Section: 2. Execution 
Hazard: Incorrect Signalling 
Consequence: Incorrect Signalling","existingMeasures":"1. Adopt Company approved hand signalling. 
2. Experienced personnel for signalling purpose. 
3. Only one nominated person to take control & signal to crane operator.","additionalMeasures":null,"likelihood":2,"consequence":3,"likelihoodAfterExistingMeasures":2,"consequenceAfterExistingMeasures":3,"likelihoodAfterAdditionalMeasures":null,"consequenceAfterAdditionalMeasures":null},{"__typename":"RiskHazard","identifiedHazard":"Stage Plan Section: 3. Execution 
Hazard: Crane operator distraction 
Consequence: Personnel Injury, Equipment Damage","existingMeasures":"1. The person operating any lifting equipment should have no other duties that might interfere with their primary task. 
2. They should be in a proper position, facing the controls and, so far as is practicable, with a clear view of the whole operation.","additionalMeasures":null,"likelihood":1,"consequence":3,"likelihoodAfterExistingMeasures":1,"consequenceAfterExistingMeasures":3,"likelihoodAfterAdditionalMeasures":null,"consequenceAfterAdditionalMeasures":null},{"__typename":"RiskHazard","identifiedHazard":"Stage Plan Section: 3. Execution 
Hazard: Hand Injury / Pinch Points / Hand Traps 
Consequence: Personnel Injury","existingMeasures":"1. Hands and fingers are not to touch any hoisted load. 
2. A load to be guided by the use of tag lines and/or push-pull sticks. 
3. Crane signaler must not be involved in any other job. 
4. Wear appropriate gloves.","additionalMeasures":null,"likelihood":3,"consequence":2,"likelihoodAfterExistingMeasures":3,"consequenceAfterExistingMeasures":2,"likelihoodAfterAdditionalMeasures":null,"consequenceAfterAdditionalMeasures":null},{"__typename":"RiskHazard","identifiedHazard":"Stage Plan Section: 3. Lifting and Connecting Hose 
Hazard: Crane malfunction 
Consequence: Personal injury, damage to ships equipment","existingMeasures":"1. Inspection before use, maintenance, awareness, functional test and load test to be done prior arrival","additionalMeasures":null,"likelihood":2,"consequence":4,"likelihoodAfterExistingMeasures":2,"consequenceAfterExistingMeasures":4,"likelihoodAfterAdditionalMeasures":null,"consequenceAfterAdditionalMeasures":null},{"__typename":"RiskHazard","identifiedHazard":"Stage Plan Section: 4. Bunker Transfer 
Hazard: Internal on board communications failure 
Consequence: Envirnomental damage","existingMeasures":"1. Frequest radio checks as per C/E instructions. Pre-operation briefing /  instructions. 
2. Call extra personnel if required. 
3. Fresh radio batteries at start of operation.","additionalMeasures":null,"likelihood":2,"consequence":3,"likelihoodAfterExistingMeasures":2,"consequenceAfterExistingMeasures":3,"likelihoodAfterAdditionalMeasures":null,"consequenceAfterAdditionalMeasures":null},{"__typename":"RiskHazard","identifiedHazard":"Stage Plan Section: 5. Close Out 
Hazard: Incorrect Stowage 
Consequence: Personnel Injury, Equipment Damage","existingMeasures":"1. Secure after stowage, avoid high unstable stacking. 
2. When work is completed, the power should be shut off.","additionalMeasures":null,"likelihood":2,"consequence":3,"likelihoodAfterExistingMeasures":2,"consequenceAfterExistingMeasures":3,"likelihoodAfterAdditionalMeasures":null,"consequenceAfterAdditionalMeasures":null}],"methodDescription":"Standard procedures for lifting operation"}
